text:
Apache server receives a HEAD requests and send it to tomcat using mod_jk.

If the virtualhost is an IP based VirtualHost, then the tomcat server receives 
a HEAD request and generate the appropriate response.

If the VirtualHost is a named based one (so after a NameVirtualHost 
directive), then the tomcat server receives a GET request (instead of the HEAD 
one sent by the client), generate a response which seems to be truncated by 
Apache or mod_jk to fit the HEAD specification (no content in the request).
creator: francois.jeanmougin@123multimedia.com

text:
This bug only appears with mod_jk and not with a regular apache static file 
server or a tomcat server behind mod_proxy. Could it be related to AJP13 or 
something like that ?
creator: francois.jeanmougin@123multimedia.com
rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
Same bug reorted to tomcat-dev today:

http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=tomcat-dev&m=110846894706676&w=2

Fixed by Mladen Turk in development tree for 1.2.9:

http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=tomcat-dev&m=110846972011636&w=2

and

http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=tomcat-dev&m=110846948908355&w=2
